Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.bitbybit.model.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the Jeopardy game. Each player has a name, a score, and a unique ID.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player(String name)
    Constructs a new Player with the given name.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name)
      Constructs a new Player with the given name. The player's score is initialized to 0, and a unique ID is generated.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's name.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns the current score of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's score.

    • addScore

      public void addScore(int points)
      Adds points to the player's score.
      Parameters:
      points - The number of points to add.

    • subtractScore

      public void subtractScore(int points)
      Subtracts points from the player's score. The score will not go below zero.
      Parameters:
      points - The number of points to subtract.

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Returns the unique ID of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's ID.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the player, including their name and score.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string for the player.
